contentrichtext.text: '''Yusuf Dia Pasha al-Khalidi''' ({{lang-ar|يوسف ضياء باشا الخالدي}}, {{transl|ar|''Yousef Ḍiya’ Bāshā al-Khalidī''}}) was a prominent [[Palestinian people|Palestinian]] who played a major political role in the [[Ottoman Empire]] dominance period. He was born in 1829 in [[Jerusalem]]. He was elected to represent the [[Jerusalem]] district in the first ''Ottoman Parliament'' (1877), he became head of the ''Jerusalem Municipality'' in (1899), and died in 1907. Al-Khalidi played a key role in the opposing political factions established to prohibit the Ottoman Empire's attempts to violate the constitution. He also wrote the first [[Kurdish language|Kurdish]]-[[Arabic language|Arabic]] dictionary. ==External links== * [http://www.passia.org/palestine_facts/personalities/alpha_k.htm PASSIA] {{Mayors of Jerusalem}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Khalidi, Yousef al- | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = 1829 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 1907 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Khalidi, Yousef al-}} [[Category:Arabs in Ottoman Palestine]] [[Category:Mayors of Jerusalem]] [[Category:1829 births]] [[Category:1907 deaths]] {{Palestine-mayor-stub}} {{Ottoman-bio-stub}}
